intro: Anacheilium jauanum, commonly known as the Jauanum orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, often fragrant blossoms. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as rainforests, where it attaches itself to tree trunks or branches. Its leaves are usually narrow and elongated, adapted for efficient water absorption in its natural habitat. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
